     305           1 : NS_IMPL_ISUPPORTS(mozilla::dom::cache::Context::QuotaInitRunnable, nsIRunnable);
     306             : 
     307             : // The QuotaManager init state machine is represented in the following diagram:
     308             : //
     309             : //    +---------------+
     310             : //    |     Start     |      Resolve(error)
     311             : //    | (Orig Thread) +---------------------+
     312             : //    +-------+-------+                     |
     313             : //            |                             |
     314             : // +----------v-----------+                 |
     315             : // |       GetInfo        |  Resolve(error) |
     316             : // |    (Main Thread)     +-----------------+
     317             : // +----------+-----------+                 |
     318             : //            |                             |
     319             : // +----------v-----------+                 |
     320             : // |  CreateQuotaManager  |  Resolve(error) |
     321             : // |    (Orig Thread)     +-----------------+
     322             : // +----------+-----------+                 |
     323             : //            |                             |
     324             : // +----------v-----------+                 |
     325             : // |    OpenDirectory     |  Resolve(error) |
     326             : // |    (Orig Thread)     +-----------------+
     327             : // +----------+-----------+                 |
     328             : //            |                             |
     329             : // +----------v-----------+                 |
     330             : // | WaitForDirectoryLock |  Resolve(error) |
     331             : // |    (Orig Thread)     +-----------------+
     332             : // +----------+-----------+                 |
     333             : //            |                             |
     334             : // +----------v------------+                |
     335             : // |EnsureOriginInitialized| Resolve(error) |
     336             : // |   (Quota IO Thread)   +----------------+
     337             : // +----------+------------+                |
     338             : //            |                             |
     339             : // +----------v------------+                |
     340             : // |     RunOnTarget       | Resolve(error) |
     341             : // |   (Target Thread)     +----------------+
     342             : // +----------+------------+                |
     343             : //            |                             |
     344             : //  +---------v---------+            +------v------+
     345             : //  |      Running      |            |  Completing |
     346             : //  | (Target Thread)   +------------>(Orig Thread)|
     347             : //  +-------------------+            +------+------+
     348             : //                                          |
     349             : //                                    +-----v----+
     350             : //                                    | Complete |
     351             : //                                    +----------+
     352             : //
     353             : // The initialization process proceeds through the main states.  If an error
     354             : // occurs, then we transition to Completing state back on the original thread.
     355             : NS_IMETHODIMP
     356           1 : Context::QuotaInitRunnable::Run()
     357             : {
     358             :   // May run on different threads depending on the state.  See individual
     359             :   // state cases for thread assertions.
     360             :

     362             : 
     363           1 :   switch(mState) {
     364             :     // -----------------------------------
     365             :     case STATE_GET_INFO:
     366             :     {
     367             :       MOZ_ASSERT(NS_IsMainThread());
     368             : 
     369           1 :       if (mCanceled) {
     370           0 :         resolver->Resolve(NS_ERROR_ABORT);
     371           0 :         break;
     372             :       }
     373             :

     377             :                                                        &mQuotaInfo.mSuffix,
     378             :                                                        &mQuotaInfo.mGroup,
     379           1 :                                                        &mQuotaInfo.mOrigin);
     380           1 :       if (NS_WARN_IF(NS_FAILED(rv))) {
     381           0 :         resolver->Resolve(rv);
     382           0 :         break;
     383             :       }
     384             : 
     385           1 :       mState = STATE_CREATE_QUOTA_MANAGER;
     386           1 :       MOZ_ALWAYS_SUCCEEDS(
     387             :         mInitiatingThread->Dispatch(this, nsIThread::DISPATCH_NORMAL));
     388           1 :       break;
     389             :     }
     390             :     // ----------------------------------
     391             :     case STATE_CREATE_QUOTA_MANAGER:
     392             :     {
     393             :       NS_ASSERT_OWNINGTHREAD(QuotaInitRunnable);
     394             : 
     395           1 :       if (mCanceled || QuotaManager::IsShuttingDown()) {
     396           0 :         resolver->Resolve(NS_ERROR_ABORT);
     397           0 :         break;
     398             :       }
     399             : 
     400           1 :       if (QuotaManager::Get()) {

     402           1 :         return NS_OK;

     436             :                                                   mQuotaInfo.mGroup,

     438           1 :                                                   getter_AddRefs(mQuotaInfo.mDir));

     440           0 :         resolver->Resolve(rv);
     441           0 :         break;

     443             : 
     444           1 :       mState = STATE_RUN_ON_TARGET;
     445             : 
     446           1 :       MOZ_ALWAYS_SUCCEEDS(
     447             :         mTarget->Dispatch(this, nsIThread::DISPATCH_NORMAL));
     448             :       break;
     449             :     }

     451             :     case STATE_RUN_ON_TARGET:

     470             :

     474             :     case STATE_COMPLETING:
     475             :     {
     476             :       NS_ASSERT_OWNINGTHREAD(QuotaInitRunnable);
     477           1 :       mInitAction->CompleteOnInitiatingThread(mResult);
     478           1 :       mContext->OnQuotaInit(mResult, mQuotaInfo, mDirectoryLock.forget());
     479           1 :       mState = STATE_COMPLETE;
     480             : 
     481             :       // Explicitly cleanup here as the destructor could fire on any of
     482             :       // the threads we have bounced through.
     483           1 :       Clear();
     484           1 :       break;
     485             :     }
     486             :     // -----
     487             :     case STATE_WAIT_FOR_DIRECTORY_LOCK:
     488             :     default:
     489             :     {
     490           0 :       MOZ_CRASH("unexpected state in QuotaInitRunnable");
     491             :     }
     492             :   }
     493             : 
     494           1 :   if (resolver->Resolved()) {
     495           1 :     Complete(resolver->Result());

     501             : // Runnable wrapper around Action objects dispatched on the Context.  This

     564             :     // We ultimately must complete on the initiating thread, but bounce through
     565             :     // the current thread again to ensure that we don't destroy objects and
     566             :     // state out from under the currently running action's stack.
     567           1 :     mState = STATE_RESOLVING;
     568             : 
     569             :     // If we were resolved synchronously within Action::RunOnTarget() then we
     570             :     // can avoid a thread bounce and just resolve once RunOnTarget() returns.
     571             :     // The Run() method will handle this by looking at mState after
     572             :     // RunOnTarget() returns.
     573           1 :     if (mExecutingRunOnTarget) {
     574           1 :       return;
     575             :     }
     576             : 
     577             :     // Otherwise we are in an asynchronous resolve.  And must perform a thread
     578             :     // bounce to run on the target thread again.
     579           1 :     MOZ_ALWAYS_SUCCEEDS(
     580             :       mTarget->Dispatch(this, nsIThread::DISPATCH_NORMAL));
     581             :   }
     582             : 
     583             : private:

     587           1 :     MOZ_DIAGNOSTIC_ASSERT(!mContext);
     588           1 :     MOZ_DIAGNOSTIC_ASSERT(!mAction);

     627             : 
     628           1 : NS_IMPL_ISUPPORTS(mozilla::dom::cache::Context::ActionRunnable, nsIRunnable);
     629             : 
     630             : // The ActionRunnable has a simpler state machine.  It basically needs to run
     631             : // the action on the target thread and then complete on the original thread.
     632             : //
     633             : //   +-------------+
     634             : //   |    Start    |
     635             : //   |(Orig Thread)|
     636             : //   +-----+-------+
     637             : //         |
     638             : // +-------v---------+
     639             : // |  RunOnTarget    |
     640             : // |Target IO Thread)+---+ Resolve()
     641             : // +-------+---------+   |
     642             : //         |             |
     643             : // +-------v----------+  |
     644             : // |     Running      |  |
     645             : // |(Target IO Thread)|  |
     646             : // +------------------+  |
     647             : //         | Resolve()   |
     648             : // +-------v----------+  |
     649             : // |     Resolving    <--+                   +-------------+
     650             : // |                  |                      |  Completing |
     651             : // |(Target IO Thread)+---------------------->(Orig Thread)|
     652             : // +------------------+                      +-------+-----+
     653             : //                                                   |
     654             : //                                                   |
     655             : //                                              +----v---+
     656             : //                                              |Complete|
     657             : //                                              +--------+
     658             : //
     659             : // Its important to note that synchronous actions will effectively Resolve()
     660             : // out of the Running state immediately.  Asynchronous Actions may remain
     661             : // in the Running state for some time, but normally the ActionRunnable itself
     662             : // does not see any execution there.  Its all handled internal to the Action.
     663             : NS_IMETHODIMP
     664           1 : Context::ActionRunnable::Run()
     665             : {
     666           1 :   switch(mState) {
     667             :     // ----------------------
     668             :     case STATE_RUN_ON_TARGET:
     669             :     {
     670             :       MOZ_ASSERT(NS_GetCurrentThread() == mTarget);
     671           1 :       MOZ_DIAGNOSTIC_ASSERT(!mExecutingRunOnTarget);
     672             : 
     673             :       // Note that we are calling RunOnTarget().  This lets us detect
     674             :       // if Resolve() is called synchronously.
     675           1 :       AutoRestore<bool> executingRunOnTarget(mExecutingRunOnTarget);
     676           1 :       mExecutingRunOnTarget = true;
     677             : 
     678           1 :       mState = STATE_RUNNING;
     679           1 :       mAction->RunOnTarget(this, mQuotaInfo, mData);
     680             : 
     681           1 :       mData = nullptr;
     682             : 
     683             :       // Resolve was called synchronously from RunOnTarget().  We can
     684             :       // immediately move to completing now since we are sure RunOnTarget()
     685             :       // completed.
     686           1 :       if (mState == STATE_RESOLVING) {
     687             :         // Use recursion instead of switch case fall-through...  Seems slightly
     688             :         // easier to understand.
     689           1 :         Run();
     690             :       }
     691             : 
     692             :       break;
     693             :     }
     694             :     // -----------------
     695             :     case STATE_RESOLVING:
     696             :     {
     697             :       MOZ_ASSERT(NS_GetCurrentThread() == mTarget);
     698             :       // The call to Action::RunOnTarget() must have returned now if we
     699             :       // are running on the target thread again.  We may now proceed
     700             :       // with completion.
     701           1 :       mState = STATE_COMPLETING;
     702             :       // Shutdown must be delayed until all Contexts are destroyed.  Crash
     703             :       // for this invariant violation.
     704           1 :       MOZ_ALWAYS_SUCCEEDS(
     705             :         mInitiatingThread->Dispatch(this, nsIThread::DISPATCH_NORMAL));
     706             :       break;
     707             :     }
     708             :     // -------------------
     709             :     case STATE_COMPLETING:
     710             :     {
     711             :       NS_ASSERT_OWNINGTHREAD(ActionRunnable);
     712           1 :       mAction->CompleteOnInitiatingThread(mResult);
     713           1 :       mState = STATE_COMPLETE;
     714             :       // Explicitly cleanup here as the destructor could fire on any of
     715             :       // the threads we have bounced through.
     716           1 :       Clear();
     717           1 :       break;
     718             :     }
     719             :     // -----------------
     720             :     default:
     721             :     {
     722           0 :       MOZ_CRASH("unexpected state in ActionRunnable");
     723             :       break;
     724             :     }
     725             :   }
     726           1 :   return NS_OK;
     727             : }
     728             : 
     729             : void

     768           1 : Context::ThreadsafeHandle::~ThreadsafeHandle()
     769             : {
     770             :   // Normally we only touch mStrongRef on the owning thread.  This is safe,
     771             :   // however, because when we do use mStrongRef on the owning thread we are
     772             :   // always holding a strong ref to the ThreadsafeHandle via the owning
     773             :   // runnable.  So we cannot run the ThreadsafeHandle destructor simultaneously.
     774           1 :   if (!mStrongRef || mOwningThread == NS_GetCurrentThread()) {
     775             :     return;
     776             :   }
     777             : 
     778             :   // Dispatch is guaranteed to succeed here because we block shutdown until
     779             :   // all Contexts have been destroyed.
     780           0 :   NS_ProxyRelease(mOwningThread, mStrongRef.forget());
     781           1 : }
     782             : 
     783             : void
     784           1 : Context::ThreadsafeHandle::AllowToCloseOnOwningThread()
     785             : {
     786             :   MOZ_ASSERT(mOwningThread == NS_GetCurrentThread());
     787             : 
     788             :   // A Context "closes" when its ref count drops to zero.  Dropping this
     789             :   // strong ref is necessary, but not sufficient for the close to occur.
     790             :   // Any outstanding IO will continue and keep the Context alive.  Once
     791             :   // the Context is idle, it will be destroyed.
     792             : 
     793             :   // First, tell the context to flush any target thread shared data.  This
     794             :   // data must be released on the target thread prior to running the Context
     795             :   // destructor.  This will schedule an Action which ensures that the
     796             :   // ~Context() is not immediately executed when we drop the strong ref.
     797           1 :   if (mStrongRef) {
     798           1 :     mStrongRef->DoomTargetData();
     799             :   }
     800             : 
     801             :   // Now drop our strong ref and let Context finish running any outstanding
     802             :   // Actions.
     803           1 :   mStrongRef = nullptr;
     804           1 : }
     805             : 
     806             : void
     807           0 : Context::ThreadsafeHandle::InvalidateAndAllowToCloseOnOwningThread()
     808             : {
     809             :   MOZ_ASSERT(mOwningThread == NS_GetCurrentThread());
     810             :   // Cancel the Context through the weak reference.  This means we can
     811             :   // allow the Context to close by dropping the strong ref, but then
     812             :   // still cancel ongoing IO if necessary.
     813           0 :   if (mWeakRef) {
     814           0 :     mWeakRef->Invalidate();
     815             :   }
     816             :   // We should synchronously have AllowToCloseOnOwningThread called when
     817             :   // the Context is canceled.
     818           0 :   MOZ_DIAGNOSTIC_ASSERT(!mStrongRef);
     819           0 : }

    1130           1 : Context::DoomTargetData()
    1131             : {
    1132             :   NS_ASSERT_OWNINGTHREAD(Context);
    1133           1 :   MOZ_DIAGNOSTIC_ASSERT(mData);
    1134             : 
    1135             :   // We are about to drop our reference to the Data.  We need to ensure that
    1136             :   // the ~Context() destructor does not run until contents of Data have been
    1137             :   // released on the Target thread.
    1138             : 
    1139             :   // Dispatch a no-op Action.  This will hold the Context alive through a
    1140             :   // roundtrip to the target thread and back to the owning thread.  The
    1141             :   // ref to the Data object is cleared on the owning thread after creating
    1142             :   // the ActionRunnable, but before dispatching it.
    1143           1 :   RefPtr<Action> action = new NullAction();
    1144           1 :   DispatchAction(action, true /* doomed data */);
    1145             :
